revised_title: Contributions to Terrestrial Magnetism: A Southern Ocean Magnetic Survey
tldr: This article discusses the results of the Magnetic Survey of the Southern Ocean conducted by Sir James Clark Ross and Captain Francis Rawdon Crozier between 1839 and 1843. The author, Edward Sabine, presents a detailed exposition of the operations of the third year of the survey, covering the Southern Atlantic between Cape Horn and the Cape of Good Hope. The findings will be used to revise M. Gauss's 'Allgemeine Theory des Erdmagnetismus'.
